Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: S J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a perfect location. Everywhere within walking distance with the trams running just round the corner. The bed was so comfortable I never wanted to leave

Reviews.Title: “A well kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Gary488
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to an exclusive shopping street with all the designer brands. You can get there on the 2 & 5 tram & I would recommend this as its a good walk from the station. Get off at the Museums stop and its just in a street across the road. The hotel is an old house or group of houses. Its nicely done in a traditional manner. The staff are very helpful. Breakfast is expensive at 19 euro. On our first morning we decided to look elsewhere and ended up at a pancake house. We saved a little but not enough to make us do it again the next day. So we tried the buffet in the hotel. There was a good mix of things to eat/drink so if your not worried about the cost its better to eat at the hotel. If there is 4 of you take a taxi back to airport its about the same as a days tram pass and the train fare.

Reviews.Title: “A fine base for visiting Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dre77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just outside of the main streets of Amsterdam and is perfectly postioned very close to the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. It is a very pleasant and safe district but chaps be warned, its is also very close to an expensive shopping street filled with Chanel and Louis Vuitton and during the winter months an ice skating rink - needless to say the 'girls' will be getting their own back on you! The hotel itself is fine - the rooms are nice and warm but we were slightly dissapointed that the double room was in fact 2 single beds pushed together with 2 seperate sets of bed covers - hence a twin room with the beds moved next to each other - not the last word in romance if you are planning a special weekend away. Staff at the hotel were friendly and overall it was a nice laid back place. The number 2 and 5 trams are very close by, and they will take you to the heart of the attractions quickly. Not sure about having to pay the 'Tourist Tax' though, which I thought was a bit cheeky at around 6 Euros!!!

Reviews.Title: “clean and great location.”
Reviews.Author: rebeccalockwood
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my husband at the end of January for a couple of nights. Fab location, quiet and slept like a log in a very comfy and clean double bed (Room number 5). Nothing outstanding but good for the weekend. Staff helpful where necessary. We decided against breakfast as we know these can be expensive and managed to find plenty of places to eat nearby with probably a little more atmosphere. We had a few drinks in the Bar but wine by the glass was extremely pricey. The only thing i would mention is that the rooms were a little on the chilly side (ie no heating on a very cold weekend) but the duvet was cosy once you got beneath it!! I am sure if i had complained, they would have told me how to adjust the heating....its just that the radiators were cold and i could see now obvious ways of adjusting Extras such as tea and coffee are to be found above mini bar although they are a bit scant on the ground!. Hairdryer in bathroom was ok and soap/shampoo was adequate if not a little "cheap" but i would go there again....just for the location and its clean rooms and nice bed linen There was a bit of mould around shower (showere over bath...basic but worked) but nothing that would cause me to freak out! This is Amsterdam after all! Visited Van Gogh and Bols experience which were 2 minutes away by foot. Would highly recommend Bols experience. Cocktails at midday? Bring it on!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CJAGlas
Reviews.Content: Overall we were quite disappointed with this hotel for several reasons. Firstly the rooms were very small. Secondly the breakfast was very expensive and thirdly we were hit with extra taxes at the very end of our stay. It's in the small print but expect to pay an extra 30 to 40 euros on top of the price you paid upfront. Staff were variable in their friendliness and professionalism. Great location, but you could find more for your money. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, cold and noisy”
Reviews.Author: lad1916
Reviews.Content: The location is decent, the heating system, hopelessly inadequate and bearing in mind the night I was there did not drop below zero. The windows rattled all night long, I assume due to trams/trains in the vicinity as it was not windy. Cleanliness: There was a blood stain on my pillowcase and the bathroom was okayish but I could not say sufficiently clean The shower was a overhead water dispensing device with a curtain and no bottom hence a soaking bathroom floor. Breakfast was an overprices boring affair. Internet charges are per device and also overpriced, all in all a place I would advise against.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel @ a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jkmani
Reviews.Content: My wife & I read the reviews about this hotel before booking. We booked about 3 weeks before our stay and got a rate of 99 Euros per night for double-occupancy. This seemed on a slightly higher side (but upon arriving in Amsterdam, we realized nothing was cheap). The staff at the hotel were very friendly. We were allowed to keep our bags for 4+ hours after checking out (since we had our flight later in the evening). Whats great about this hotel is the location - its just bang in the middle of seemingly everything yet in a quite neighbourhood. You are about 3 mins from the Van Gogh museum, 3 mins from the Coster Diamond museum, 4 mins from the Rijks museum, 5-6 mins from the place where you can take the canal cruise and 6-7 minutes from the happening Leidseplein square. The room itself is small which isn't a big surprise if you are in Western Europe and the bathroom+toilet is just enough for one person. But, there is nothing to complain off here (other than the toilet itself which was pretty odd, have attached a pic). Internet is expensive - 17 Euros for 24 hours access at 1mbps speed (quite low of seeing any videos). The breakfast is the usual continental buffet. At 20 Euros per head, it seemed expensive. There is a SPA available but we didn't use it or even check it out. Overall, this hotel is highly recommended just for the location and the price (which my friends tell me is not a bad deal).

Reviews.Title: “Very conservative and traditional”
Reviews.Author: papirosse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the NY eve and it was quite difficult to find a room at this time for a reasonable price near center. The stuff is absolutely OK. All the wishes were fulfilled. The rooms are spacious and clean. They were done up every day! The price was also OK.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place you'll adore”
Reviews.Author: chrismarynyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel location: Museum district, and right by the high end stores (Chanel, Vuitton, etc...) A quick walk to all other areas, perfectly situated. The hotel lobby: Modern/ Rustic furniture. Very clean. Well maintained. Nice festive Christmas tree. The hotel staff: Very friendly and accommodating. They're helpful, and smiley and have free Olliebollen pastries every morning on the front desk counter. The hotel bar staff is also very friendly. When we got back on New Years Eve and were starving from not having had any dinner, even tho the kitchen was closed, the bartender was nice enough to make us fried cheese sticks (yum!) The hotel room: 3 of us made for a nice squeeze. Bathroom had plenty of space for 3 girls to share, hair/makeup. The elevator: I think it's cute. You can see the walls moving, so theres no actual elevator door. It's a Euro thing I think. The only negative thing? They charge 9 euros for internet/wi - fi, PER NIGHT., PER USER. I feel that is rather pricey. Either charge it, per night per room, or dont charge so much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near the Van Gogh Museum and the Rejkmuseum. The staff were very friendly and most helpful. The Breakfast is pretty standard but very good, the bar snacks are very limited and for us to be avoided. The decor of the hotel is modern and clean. Room was ok. Bed was very comfortable, good sized bathroom with shower and bath. Toiletries were replaced daily. Expensive internet connection 7 EUR per hour!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: lyftrvlr
Reviews.Content: Overall, I like this tiny hotel for its proximity to the museum, and for its good customer service. I would stay here again. When I stand up from my bed, I'm inches from the wall. However, it is much like Japanese hotels that maximize every inch of space. I was amazed with how I immediately got a compatible adapter for my video camera charger minutes after calling the front desk, and by the overall cleanliness of my room when I return in the evenings after seeing much of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location, especially for a family”
Reviews.Author: NAM77
Reviews.Content: My husband, my two year old daughter, and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. We got a great big room with a balcony (#111). The bed was very comfy and clean. The hotel is in awesome location for a family. We were 1 block from the Van Gogh museum. There is a park with a playground behind the museum. The boat tours are 3 blocks away and you get a discount card at check in. We didn't eat breakfast because there is a great place for breakfast called B&B right next to the boat tours among other restaurants. There is a great big park, Vandelpark, 2 blocks from the hotel, with a great running path, ponds with ducks, etc. There is a supermarket next to Van Gogh museum, so you can safe money on water and snacks for the kids. The neighborhood felt very safe with lots of kids. We were very close to the city center, only 2 tram stops away or a 20 min walk. The hotel staff were very nice. The only downside of the hotel that we noticed was the WiFi charge, it's 17 euros per day. Way too high!

Reviews.Title: “Not acceptable as 4*”
Reviews.Author: AshlynF
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was excellent for visiting the museums, Concertgebouw etc, but having paid decent money for a 4* hotel we found ourselves booked in to a room that may previously been the broom cupboard. There was literally no room for us to walk past each other, the bed was pressed up against a table so that we both had to get in and out the same side, and you had to lie down on the floor to access the safe (which didn't work anyway!). The bathroom was so small it would have been possible to shower, use the toilet and clean your teeth at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “Close to meseums, clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: LFLI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to a number of famous meseums in the city. Basically most meseums and even Centraal station can be reached by foot. On the other hand, can travel by tram for the same purpose. The room is not large, but is enough and comfortable. It is considered to be quiet, except only occasions with noise from motor vehicles and nightwalkers on the street that I think also unavoidable in nearby hotels. The facility is enough for basic need. But lack of free Wifi that can be found in some other hotels. Staff is friendly and helpful. Another draw back is the lack of a formal restaurant that can provide dinner as there is very limited choice around the hotel. Often needs to walk to Leidsestraat for food.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil, convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KSmith L
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's close proximity to the Van Gogh museum and we were also pleasantly suprised by how close it was to Vondel Park. The location is quiet and peaceful, with trees lining the street outside. The room itself was very comfortable with all the necessary facilities and we had a wonderful view of all the rooftops of the city. The staff were all very friendly,approachable and willing to help. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and hope to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, central and clean”
Reviews.Author: KPlovesthebeach
Reviews.Content: Bilderberg is conveniently located close to the museums. The staff were incredibly helpful and made several restaurant and bar reservations for us. Quiet and clean. The only negative would be that the computer in the lobby is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: geo8472
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bilderberg end of August for a 2 night stay with my husband and we were both very pleased with the hotel, room and the staff. If you are interested in the museums this is the place to be but the tram is just a 2 minute walk from the hotel and takes to all the various places you need to get the Amsterdam experience. From the airport we took the bus which was only about 40 minutes to get to the hotel and the stop was about 5 minute walk to the hotel and it only cost each 5 euros each so was brilliant. Just asked the information desk at the airport which bus to take. We also bought the Amsterdam card which was a great help and you get loads of vouchers for restaurants and free tram travel and and also entrance to various places etc. It was a wonderful 3 days in Amsterdam and i would highly recommend this hotel. Great location and good clean rooms. We didn't have breakfast here so unable to comment on that but there are plenty of food places.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room in good location”
Reviews.Author: Andy G
Reviews.Content: pretty comfortable, clean with decent decor but a bit small (standard room) like most European hotels so not a big issue. Location is great within walking distance to most things or a short tram ride. Reasonably quiet which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: WOMAN101
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel with modern look. Clean rooms. Some staff not very friendly. Overall enjoyed our stay and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star hotel should not have A 2 star Room to sleep in!”
Reviews.Author: jdb44
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent chose this hotel based on the services and location. Truthfully, the wonderful staff, breakfast, and good location were Nullified by the hotel room that fit only a bed and a desk. Two people could not fit in the bathroom at one time. With luggage pushed against the wall, it was an obstacle course moving around the bed to go to the front door. Bed uncomfortable and photographs are deceiving. Too bD you have to sleep there... Everything else is quite lovely

Reviews.Title: “Had my doubts but turned out to be a great stay”
Reviews.Author: aucdoha
Reviews.Content: There were some mixed reviews for this hotel and honestly the only reason I booked it was because they were one of the only hotels with a double room available. However the stay turned out to be wonderful. Upon check in there was a problem with my reservation as they did not have any double rooms available but the lady was very nice and offered my mother and I two single rooms side by side for the same price as the double, perfect! Both of us loved our rooms, nice tv's, we could fully open our windows, beds were comfy, clean, etc... Great location, close to museums, tram into city center, on a side street so quiet at all times, some eateries nearby. Front desk staff also very helpful. Actually I just thought of something that I didn't like: no free internet, I think internet access was like 13 euro for 24hr access, that is what is keeping me from giving it 5 stars but other than that I loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Doodie018
Reviews.Content: We only had one night here but thought the staff were wonderful and the rooms were very clean and a good size. Beautiful area in close proximity to the Van Gogh museum and excellent shopping district! A really good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Big_P_123
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay in a superior room. Despite confirming with the receptionist that we had booked a "superior" room, we were given a standard room, which was tiny . After contacting reception twice we were moved to a "superior" room, which we should have been given in the first place. Not a good start to our stay. We also booked a dinner as part of our stay. If you go to the terms and conditions it states that this will be provided in another hotel. I did not read this -ultimately my fault- but there is a natural assumption that if a hotel is offering dinner booking that it will be within its premises. And if that is not the case, this important difference should be made clear on the first level of detail, not tucked away in the terms and conditions. And what it does not say anywhere is that the dinner venue is a good 15 minutes walk away. It was my intention to relax and have dinner in the hotel on our first evening after travelling. I cancelled the booking. The following day the hotel told me I would be charged for the dinner we did not have. It did offer pay for a taxi on another evening, but we had other plans for the remaining evenings. In our "superior" room, the tv was old and small, with poor reception, the bathrobes were cheap and overall the was an feeling of penny pinching. The hotel was clean, and in a good location for visiting the museums - which is why we choose it- and the staff were polite and friendly. Superficially the hotel seems to be in a quiet location, but at nightime there is occassional but significant noise from passers by. I have stayed in Amsterdam many times, so I am well able to make relative judgements about this hotel. Overall, you can do better for the same cost. This is at the lower end for a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"A gem of a small hotel in a convenient location - good place for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights as part of our trip to Santorini Greece with KLM before returning to Vancouver Canada. We are a senior couple and were lucky our daughter could travel with us. We all enjoyed the quiet ambiance and good service we enjoyed here, The rooms were small but very adequate. There is a small bar with a nice outdoor terrace. The breakfast was very good served buffet style. If you requested a reservation for breakfast the night before the price was very competitive. We were able to walk to the Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh. If you purchased tickets at near by Key Tours office you didn't have to wait in line. Buying 24 hour passes on the canal boats was a great way to see a lot of Amsterdam and learn a lot of history from the canal boat drivers. Watching the cyclists was an ongoing wonder!

Reviews.Title: “Very medium 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcflyyoupi
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for 3 nights at the Bilderberg hotel Jan Luyken in July 2011. The hotel is clean, and located just nearby the Van Gogh museum, and at the corner of the most expensive shops street from Amsterdam. We got a quite small room (twin beds), with an old TV, and not much space to walk around the bed. The bathroom was ok (seemed that it has been refurbished recently). Regarding noise, this was fine (not perfect silence, especially given the people that can walk outside, but fine for us). We also had breakfast once: disappointing, given the quite high price (almost 20 EUR), with poor choice of meals and bad juices. Overall fine, but probably a bit expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MCBDurham
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Amsterdam on the 2nd July, having booked two superior rooms at the Bilderberg Hotel Jan Luyken. Transportation to Amsterdam Central via the overland train was simple, and having purchased 72hr passes at the airport, we were clear to transfer onto the excellent tram service to our hotel. I had read from previous reviewers that tram numbers 5 & 22 would get us to the hotel, which proved to be 'on the nail'. Off the tram, a 2 minute walk and we were at the hotel. Reception was efficient and welcoming, and the superior rooms were definately worth the extra. My wife and I had a third floor room with large opening windows, which gave a feeling of spaceousness normally associated with a terrace or balcony. My daughter and her friend had aslightly smaller first floor room, but this time with french doors and a balcony. The rooms were clean and almost boutique style, with a good size bathroom and complimentary amenities. The location is only a pleasant 10mins or so from Dam Square (by tram), and there are numerous entertainment and dining locations along the route. We regularly hopped on and off the tram en route, simply to take in the street vendors and cafe's along the way. The hotel has a great policy of locking the entrance around 8pm, which adds to the feeling of security, though the area appeared clean and respectable throughout our visit. Entry is achieved by simply ringing the door bell, and 'hey presto', so long as your face is recognised by the duty personal. Daily service was efficient and punctual, and my request for a taxi retutrn to Schiphol was undertaken without any consequence, and cheaper than standard rates. The use of a Mercedes car is also a bonus, especially for the price paid (EU 35.00 flat rate for 4 persons). Overall a good hotel, good location and thoroughly enjoyable stay. Many thanks to all at the Jan Luyken!! CMB

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience - highly recommended for museum puffs and alike!”
Reviews.Author: Pepromene
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good - on a peaceful, beautiful street, very close to the museums and the shopping streets. The tram is also nearby with easy access to the airport and the city centre. The staff was very kind and helpful - the room my family member had reserved turned out to be smaller than expected with one kingsize bed, but they managed to make accomodations so that we received a bigger room with a small extra fee and made the requested changes regarding location of the beds. The rooms were quite nice and the bathroom was very modern and very good. Highly recommended for museum puffs and shoppers!

Reviews.Title: “Only once for me”
Reviews.Author: Smibble
Reviews.Content: The description said 5 minutes from Centraal Station - untrue. The room was the smallest I have ever stayed in. The street outside looked quiet but it was not and sound insulation non-existent. Clean hotel, nice staff but out of the way and that room was so small. wi-fi expensive at E13.50 Small bottle Evian E5 Shower and loo on top of each other so wet loo floor A really poor experience made worse by the need to pay lots to travel to meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Hotel - A few words of caution though!....”
Reviews.Author: billyboy68
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel, and checked in. The female reception staff were very friendly, informative, and made a very good first impression. We went up to stay in our standard double room; 209. The room was very small. No double bed - just 2 beds pushed together, and the room was quite cramped (although was modern and well furnished to be fair). Bathroom was tiny as well - no bath, just a shower. We stayed there 1 night and decided to raise the issue with the reception staff. They explained that the standard rooms are quite small, however, we could upgrade to a business room for 15 euro per night, or a superior room which was much more. The lovely receptionist gave us a key to one of the empty rooms and we went and had a look. It was so much better! Lovely king-sized bed, larger room, much bigger bathroom with a bath. So we made the transfer next door to room 210. If you are travelling alone, the standard rooms would probably suit. However, if you are a couple, or used to larger rooms, a business or superior room would most definetely be better for you - so consider this when you are booking to avoid dissapointment. We absolutely loved our business room! We booked breakfast included in our stay. The breakfast was very nice. Quite a good choice, of contenental or cooked/hot breakfast. The breakfast room was nice too. What we did find though, is there is a younger, fair-haired guy working down there who we found incredibly surly. It was enough to put you off your breakfast. This guy could do with some serious customer service training. Why he woke up one morning and decided to work in the hospitality business is a wonder. Management of the Bilderberg - he is the only weak link in your staff - so please do something about this. I was also horrified to see him working behind the reception some of the time too - which may count for the bad reviews for the reception staff. Totally unfair for the other staff who are working hard to please everyone, and doing a great job. Another thing I would mention is that during the stay for 5 nights, I was never able to clearly identify who the duty manager was, so it gives the impression that there isn't one and the place is self managing. The other negatives would be, they need to consider providing wireless internet for their rooms which is reasonably affordable. The quality of this hotel is very good, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping, Parks + Van Gough”
Reviews.Author: neverturnright
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Great location if you love high end shopping, strolls in the park and Van Gough. Well appointed rooms. Good size lift. Helpful staff. A couple of steps between lift and room. Stayed in rooms 201 + 202. One of the rooms was roomy and one was smaller but with a little balcony overlooking the charming tree lined street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: MStave
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to describe this fantastic hotel. The stay was a birthdaypresent from my fiancee and when the clerk hear about that, and also that we were just engaged, she upgraded our room from standard to superior. And superior indeed!! :o) The spa at the hotel after a day in the city - or when you are tired after a long travel? Oh YES! It is like charging the batteries, and by the way, the whole hotel is like a charger. You can relax, enjoy a cup of coffee, or just take a chat with the bartender or clerk, they are always polite, first class, and know how to make a guest feel like a VIP. When we left the hotel early in the morning, the hotel had made a reservation for a taxi for us to Schiphol, and this taxi really made the trip. If it was a coincidence or not - anyway the taxi was a big Mercedes limousine.... Thank you very much for a wonderful and memorable stay, we will be back. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: retford67
Reviews.Content: To an American the Bilderberg rooms probably do feel a little small. However, by European standards they're okay. You have to remember you're in the old part of town, in an old building and the size of the room is the payoff. The most important thing for me is that the hotel is clean and I can get a good sleep. My room was spotless; the bathroom pristine. Things are a little quaint - like the wall-mounted music player that's been mentioned - but don't let that put you off. The location is excellent - a quiet street yet just turn the corner and you're at the diamond museum and the Rijksmuseum. The room cost isn't cheap, but it isn't expensive either. I would caution that if you select a very cheap hotel in Amsterdam then be prepared for a something a little "ropey" - they're mostly still clean but very old fashioned and may be out of the way. I would happily return to the Bilderberg. It is excellent for sightseeing and was well positioned for my conference. The staff were polite, friendly and like most Dutch people speak excellent English. With regards to getting to the hotel I caught a shared taxi-bus from the airport which currently costs 15.5 euro single and 30 euro return. You'll share with up to seven others in a mini bus. That takes you from right outside the airport and drops you in front of the hotel - so if you're travelling in the evening then it's a great option (in the middle of the night you'll have to get a taxi though). You can prebook the shared taxi bus or get a ticket from tourist information at the airport. Some people also seemed to pay on the bus, though I was told you had to prebook. I caught a train from Central station back to the airport which is rapid and less than 5 euro. The downside is the location of Central station is a bit of a trek from the hotel - half an hour plus walk (?). If you plan well you could visit that part of town on your last day and then catch the train. Another alternative is the bus from outside the airport - I think it's the 197, which will bring you pretty close. To me, as a British person, Amsterdam seems expensive. You do get tea and coffee in the room, but as has been mentioned 19 euro per person for breakfast is pricey; and 5 euro for water in the room is very expensive. How could the Bilderberg be better? Free WiFi in the hotel would be great, but to be fair this isn't common in Amsterdam though is something we now expect in London... I'd say I'm a pretty fussy traveller who always stays in 4/5 star hotels, and I have honestly stayed in far worse 5 star hotels than this in terms of cleanliness, friendliness, sleep quality and location. I would definitely return to the Bilderberg and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: KellyRavenna_Ohio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend. They were right. Easy to get to. Clean...very quaint hotel. Loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Youâ€™ll feel like youâ€™re in Amsterdam. (Oops, we are in Amsterdam!)”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOnLocation
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our home base for a seven-day visit to Amsterdam. Located in three attached townhouses on a quiet residential street, away from the tumult of the Dam and the red light district. Itâ€™s one block to Museumsplein (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Stedelijk Museum, Concertgebouw) and one block in the other direction to PC Hooftstraat with its high-end retailers and a couple of nice restaurants. Everything else you want to see in Amsterdam is within walking distance, though the Central Station is a bit of a hike. We never used cabs (except to the airport) or even streetcars - we walked everywhere. Currently, the outside of the building is being painted and is covered with scaffolding - something they didnâ€™t tell us when we reserved our room and is not mentioned on their website. However, it didnâ€™t interfere with our stay. Our room, 405, faced the back with a quaint view of housetops. The room is tiny, and the bathroom even tinier. Thereâ€™s a queen-sized bed that takes up practically the whole room and two people cannot pass each other in the remaining space. The bathroom is even smaller. But itâ€™s all very clean and once you visit the Anne Frank House, you wonâ€™t complain about cramped quarters. Thereâ€™s coffee and tea in the room, one small closet, an old (not flat) TV, a small desk, and a wall-mounted CD player(!?!). But youâ€™re in Amsterdam and hopefully not spending a lot of time in the room. Downstairs is a bar, a â€œspaâ€� (one room with a tanning bed, jacuzzi tub and massage chair), and a large sitting room. Staff is friendly and efficient. You can purchase museum tickets at the front desk, so no need to wait in lines when you get there. Because we were staying for six nights, we were able to negotiate a slightly lower rate, though itâ€™s still expensive like everything else in Amsterdam. At these prices, they should not be gouging you for things like a small bottle of water in the room (5 euros), 19 euros per person for breakfast (which we declined - go to Maximeâ€™s around the corner), a fee for internet use, even for the computer in the lobby if you just want to check in with the airlines. One perfunctory nod of homespun hospitality is a bowl of complimentary apples available all day at the reception desk. When we arrived, we took a cab from the airport to the hotel, which turned out to be about 50 euros with the tip. When we checked out, the receptionist said they could call a cab that would cost 35 euros to the airport. A nice new Mercedes showed up, but cost 42 euros excluding tip. The driver told us the hotel has not updated their fee schedule, and I tend to believe him. For the most part, we were pleased with our stay at the Jan Luyken Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy stay”
Reviews.Author: dfromnh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under renovations. We were woken in the morning at 7:30 to scrapping & sanding.There is scaffolding and material covering the entire front of the building and blocking the windows. The rooms are very tiny. I felt extremely claustrophobic in the tiny room with no window access. Bathroom is a joke. So small with a leaky sink. My husband had pre-paid for 2 nights and we could not get a refund. Worst 2 nights ever!

Reviews.Title: “Nice well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: diana09Brussels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the posh area of the haute couture stores. It is 5min walking to Leisdquare (nice to go out, dinner, etc) and also from the Museumplein (Rijkmuseum, Van Gog). The only negative aspect is that the heating was not functioning in our room. We had told reception before we left for dinner so they could fix the heating and they said they would check. When we came back the room was still freezing. It was on the top floor (room508) and we slept with a temperature of about 17degrees. There weren't any extra blankets either. We slept good but VERY COLD! (also not nice when you come out of the shower) Staff was very friendly, although they didn't do anything about the heating problem in the room...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Rosanne1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lovely hotel that my boyfriend found. We stayed with friends. Great location in city centre and a really charming hotel. We had a corner room (201) which was spacious and had a great view of the street, with a balcony! Bathroom was clean and large. Staff was friendly although we didn't actually need their help as we know our way around. Breakfast was nice with fresh fruit and lots to choose from. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: johnn198
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel very comfortable and convenient. It's located in the Museum District only a couple of minutes walk from some of the main museums. If you want to travel to other areas, it's also very close to the tram line. This is very convenient especially if you have the Iamsterdam card with free public transport. The room had everything we needed. A hot breakfast was included in the price. It was down to -7C when we were there with snow and the hotel was nice and warm allowing us to thaw out after very cold days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: barbierock
Reviews.Content: I was going to stay with a friend in Amsterdam but due to an emergency that was not possible so I booked a last minute room here. I really have no complaints besides the room size, my room had no space for my luggage at all. I do not expect big rooms since it's Europe but this one was SO small I could not even walk to get to the bed, it was as if I was in one of those Japanese hotels that only fits the bed :) Besides that, the hotel was great, an amazing location next to all the museums and close to everything else, walking distance to every tourist spot you want to hit. The staff was amazing, they helped me with everything and every question I had. Some of them were so friendly we were chatting for a long time! I did not experience any problems at all. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed at a B&B”
Reviews.Author: JamieBarrier
Reviews.Content: While planning our honeymoon, I left my husband in charge of choosing the hotel. We wanted something in a nice neighborhood that was close to a tram stop and somewhat romantic. He chose The Bilderberg, and felt good about his decision, so I went with it. The Bilderberg is in a lovely neighborhood, very close to upscale shopping.. quite a bit more upscale than would ever interest me, and honestly, walking through that area, I felt rather out of place at times. The Bilderberg appears a bit upscale as well.. the lobby is pretty (though very small) and the staff seem to have an "air" about them to match. Our room was on the 3rd floor, and honestly, it is the tiniest room I have ever stayed in in Europe. You could barely walk past each other in the room without being pushed into the bathroom or onto the bed. The charge for WIFI is outrageous, and the TV had very little programming, so bring a book if you're like me and have to wait forever for your spouse to get ready in the morning. It was nice that as a gift, the hotel gave us a complimentary hour in the spa room. We enjoyed that. Other than that, our contact with the staff was minimal. I wouldn't say they were overly friendly, but if we had a question, they could usually help. In retrospect, when we got home and I looked into other hotels in the area for our next trip, I found several really nice B&B's in the area that were a better rate, had free wifi, included breakfast, and were much more spacious. Next time we will go that route.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: alchemilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights.... staff very friendly and welcoming, and helpful with restaurant reservations etc. and more than happy to hand out more teabags/fresh milk for tea etc. (not sure what one previous reviewer was on about, to be honest). Clean and nicely decorated, though not much of the original character of the building seemed to remain once you get inside - but perfectly pleasant nonetheless. Our room was on the small side and overlooked some slightly tatty areas around the back of the building, but most importantly was quiet, clean and warm, and the bed a good size and very comfortable. A few minor niggles, such as nowhere in the shower to put toiletries for use while showering except on the floor, but in this this particular hotel is far from being alone.... I do wish hotels would think about this. Good location close to museums and tram stops. On which subject it is well worth investing in an Iamsterdam card - free public transport and free entry to lots of the museums, a really good system. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel but can highly recommend Studio 2 by the flower market - brilliant omelettes and pancakes and lovely coffee, with very friendly and efficient service, open at 9 am. By contrast lots of other places in the area advertising breakfast were not yet open at 1030 on a Saturday morning, which seems a bit bonkers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - service, location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: NBCedar
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nites here and we're delighted with everything. It's in a fabulous location. Walking distance to Rikjsmueum and Van Gogh, Leidersplaine and more. There are serveral trams down the street wthat will take you to most anywhere in the Amsterdam area. It's a small, pretty hotel in an old building that has been renovated. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Be sure to buy your museum tickets and tram tickets at the front desk, there is no extra charge and it will save you time. The breakfast was great, a bit pricey but worth it for the convenience. We stayed in a deluxe room and enjoyed the small balcony and extra space. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and central”
Reviews.Author: nanomog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights - and everything ran smoothly. The rooms were clean and quiet and breakfast was good. The service was a little brisk, but apart from that we'd recommend it to friends who want to stay in Amsterdam on a mid-budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful personal hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: rich_karen_10
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Bilderberg Hotel. The room was small but very clean, bright and comfortable. The space was efficiently designed. The bed was comfortable, bathroom was bright and clean and the water was hot with good water pressure. The staff was very friendly and provided assistance regarding travel routes and tourist activity. We didn't try the breakfast as it was very pricey. However, there were good sidewalk cafes close by. One of the best things about the Bilderberg is the location ...very close to the museums and parks. We highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Addis_to_be
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bilderberg Hotel for a weekend with another couple. We choose this hotel on recommendation from a friend and were not disappointed. This was our 3rd trip to Amsterdam, last time we stayed at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel which was equally as nice. This hotel can be expensive and I would not book it unless you can get it at a reasonable rate, we paid 200 Euros for 2 nights and it was well worth the money. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location on a quiet road leading off from a designer shopping street. It is right next to the Vondelpark and the Leidespein area where there are fantastic bars and restaurants and lots of street entertainers. We also went to 2 fab restaurants there - Meyer (Indian Cuisine) best indian meal Ive ever had and Gaucho, lovely steak restaurant. The hotel although not very big is very elegantly presented and has a good atmosphere. It has a quaint charm about it in a quiet and small understated way. The bar area is lovely to sit in and have drinks and so too is the terrace area. We had breakfast 1 of the mornings and it was really nice, 14 Euros, but you could eat and drink all you wanted. Amsterdam is quite pricy, the other morning we ate at a small bar/cafe and had a full english. By the time we had bought drinks (juice and tea) and tipped etc it was more expensive than the hotel anyhow. Our room was very modern and clean. It offered everything we needed but was on the small side. Most of our time in Amsterdam was in bars and restaurants to be fair and not in our room so it was more than adequate. Overall, I would say that the location, atmosphere and charm of the hotel makes this an excellent choice for a weekend break in Amsterdam. I would highly recommend and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Museum, Comfortable, Quiet, Friendly and Elegant....its all here”
Reviews.Author: vermeer60745
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Amersterdam and want to see the INCREDABLE museums (that are one block away) ride the canals, and stay in a very quiet location just far enough from the crowds of party goers STAY HERE! We just got back from staying at this WONDERFUL HOTEL that really had everything that you would want or need. We checked and and met a very pleasent and very helpful desk clerk named Marie. He upgraded our room, and showed us the best places to eat, and even booked our tickets to the museums YOU MUST DO THIS TO AVOID THE LINES at the museums!!! You can then walk right pass the long lines outside and into the exibits. No standing outside! I have no idea why so many stand in lines...Go to the Van Goug on Friday evenings and get the audio tours. Everyone was very nice and helpful and the room was very comfortable and quiet. Get the breakfast for 15EU (it was very good) get the hop on off canal boat for getting around (much better than the trolleys) that you can book at the museum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Diddyblonde
Reviews.Content: As a suprise 30th birthday present for my husband, we travelled to Amsterdam for a long weekend. I found this hotel via Expedia, we were very pleasantly suprised at how lovely the hotel was, reception were really friendly and helpful. Our room, although only a standard had plenty of space and light from a large window overlooking roof tops. The area around the hotel is quiet, but only a 5 minute walk from the lovely Vondelpark and near by cafes, bars and fantastic restaurants. We opted out of the hotel's breakfast, partly due to 19 euros seeming rather pricey, but also as there are so many lovely cafes near by. We would definately stay here again if we are lucky enough to come to back to this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: dsmith33706
Reviews.Content: As we arrived at the Bilderberg on Jan Luykenstraat, I was greeted by the warm welcome of Marijke, the front desk duty manager. Later that evening, we stopped at the lounge and she even gave us a very knowledge-filled tutorial on fine wines! The staff is what made this experience one of the most pleasant that I have ever had. They were very helpful and attended to our every need. With the professional attitude and hospitality extended by outstanding employees, like Marijke, you can count on us returning to the Bilderberg soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bilderberg for 3 nights in July. The hotel had a number of pros and cons: - Great location, the museums are very close by, there are plenty of shops and restaurants, and it is a quick walk into the centre. - Excellent customer service - the staff on reception recommended really good restaurants and were able to sell tickets to the museums to save queuing. - The decor is clean and modern, there is a nice bar with a terrace. - Our room was really small - just enough room for a double bed and then to walk round it. There was a small window, high up so that you could not see out of it. Other rooms seemed more light and airy but our one was not. - Internet access is expensive. - On one day we were given really dirty towels, I only realised once I had got out of the shower - reception did arrange for more to be brought up but the housekeeping staff did not seem concerned/apologetic. - Staff decided to paint the walls outside our room at 8am, which was quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be happier”
Reviews.Author: Betticat
Reviews.Content: Here's what I realized after doing quite a bit of research for our stop in Amsterdam- don't go cheap on the hotel or you will live to regret it. How do I know? Well, after reading reviews of other place in comparison to price what i figured out is that you can't go too cheap for a room or you will staying in hotel that normally caters to hoards of stoner college kids that congregate for other "attractions". I digress, Anyway, I took the leap and booked our stay here and I could not be happier. This was coming toward the close of our trip and the last thing we needed was a mediocre hotel. This place was clean, quiet, and in a beautiful neighborhood right near the major museums. Yes its compact but why are you spending so much time in your room when you are on vacation?? Its not so small as it is not functional for your stay. I would stay there again and again and I cannot state the courtesy of the staff. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - 5 minutes to museums; 15 minutes to Pijp district”
Reviews.Author: bevchar
Reviews.Content: Comfortable small room in a comfortable size hotel. Charge for wi-fi (probably typical) is high for recreational traveler at 17â‚¬ an hour. Parking would be hard; we picked up our car at the end of our stay in Amsterdam. Staff is friendly and helpful re transportation, tickets, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Museums area”
Reviews.Author: CulturegirlCalgary
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at this hotel in 3 years. Highly recommended. Small hotel and rooms clean, bright and spacious. A little bit of luxury away from home. Staff helpful and courteous. Handy for Vondelpark, museums, canal bus and designer shopping. Walking to Jordaan and Nine Little Streets for shopping and atmospheric bars and restaurants is easy. Hotel does not serve dinner but can get snacks in the bar in the evening. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Hotel has bikes for use too.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel well worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: dhallam62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just minutes from two of amsterdfam's top museums, the Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh, both are worth visiting, one street over from the hotel are some of the most expensive shops in the city for shopping, (or window shopping which we did). The hotel offers a level of comfort similar to any hotel found in Canada. The room size was excellent as was the bed and bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful in suggesting restaurants. They also will sell you tickets to the different museums at their cost which saves you standing in line. The only down side was the breakfast, the hot food was luke warm at 19 plus euro per person it was pricey but there were no option in the area so we paid the price. It is within walking distance of the city centre close enough to enjoy what the city offers but just far enough away that you are not bothered by any noise, I would not hesitate to stay there again, though I would serach for somewhere close by that may offer a breakfast at a reasonable rate that was warm.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for museums and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Robert-J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at the Jan Luyken which is most convenient being very close to both the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. We had a Superior room, very spacious with a large bed, a couple of arm chairs, and a well equipped work desk with Internet connections, small calculator, paper punch and stapler all to hand. An excellent choice at breakfast of cooked food - sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs and hard boiled eggs - and a cold buffet with salads, sliced meats, cheeses and smoked salmon. A well appointed bar, with an outdoor area for warmer weather, is open from 10 am until midnight and serves light dishes which make up for the fact the Hotel has no Dining Room. On our first night we had excellent mushroom and tomato soup and pleasant pizzas. Nothing elaborate but sufficient. We found the staff pleasant and helpful. The reception conveniently sells tickets to both the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh which enable you to by-pass the queues at both museums. If you wish to go further afield they also sell the new Travel Cards - either 24 or 48 hour versions both of which give you unlimited travel on bus, tram and Metro. Warning - the next street, P.C. Hoofstraat, is the smart shopping street of Amsterdam so be careful about letting your wife/partner loose. Mine saw an admittedly lovely pair of knee high red boots, but they were hand made Italian boots so far from cheap! Nevertheless she left Amsterdam very happy. Drawbacks The Breakfast Room is in the basement and the elevator does not descend that far so you have to negotiate a couple of flights of stairs. Not a problem for the fit but for the disabled elderly,as we are, quite a problem. You can have room service but that adds another 5 euros to an already far from cheap breakfast at 19 euros or 15 euros if you sign up for breakfast every day you ar staying there. Verdict. Excellent location, pleasant, helpful staff make up for a few drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Refund”
Reviews.Author: mjlothar
Reviews.Content: I didnt have the opportunity to stay at this hotel due to the volcanic eruption disrupting my travel plans, all I wanted to say in this review is that I hope that you dont get into a car accident, or another volcano erupts because this hotel will not give you a refund NO MATTER WHAT.

Reviews.Title: “Better options around ....”
Reviews.Author: droberts67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were some of the many americans stranded in Amsterdam ( for over a week now) and when we had our first flight cancelled our primary hotel had no rooms available for two days so we went down the street to the Bildeburg. It is a beautiful hotel with some modern touches certainly. The rooms was spacious but water pressure and temp were pretty iffy. What bothered us most was the $17 euro for 24 hr wifi charge PER Iphone (or computer) We were trying to get in to get in touch with home and work during our extended ash induced stay and this was not a charge we were prepared for. We ended up going back to our original hotel down the street that was less flashy but had free wifi at least. The hotel might want to look into addressing this issue

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for the 'Dam”
Reviews.Author: Bee_Good_77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of a great deal with Expedia, and pre-arranged to have breakfast for all 4 nights (saving E 4.50 a day each). I don't agree with another of the reviews which said the breakfast was awful, as we found it delicious, fresh and literally all you could eat. Get stuck in, we weren't hungry until the afternoon! The room was a good size for Amsterdam - I have paid about the same for a tiny, loud double in a tatty hotel 200 metres away - and the bathroom and furnishings were of nice quality. The staff were courteous, friendly and professional. Despite being extensively modernised the hotel still retains a lot of charm, having been converted from townhouses. The hotel is in a great location for the Museum Quarter (or fancy brand shops if that's your bag) with the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseums within a couple of minutes walk. The trams from Centraal Station also stop very close by. It didn't take us long to walk into Old Centre, de Pijp or even closer to Leidseplein for emergency supplies. If you want a lovely trip for a sunny day, take the 170 bus from by the Concertgebouw to the Amsterdamse Bos, a massive park south of the centre where you can hire a Dutch bike for about a tenner a day and cycle merrily around a lovely landscape, stopping for coma-inducing pancakes in the hidden cafe. Also if you're a film buff, check out the fantastic Kriterion cinema on Roetersstraat.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: ks2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a few days as I wanted to take my mother to the tulip fields. It cost 33 euros to get there by taxi from the airport and 41 euros on the way back! The hotel is clean and the staff really helpful (their recommended restaurant The Pantry is fantastic - you will have to book as it fills up and for 20 euros each you can have a fantastic main course and desert - it's brilliant and local). Whilst it is handy for the museums and really expensive designer shops, it is quite a way from the centre. My main criticism is that the rooms are tiny, even by city standards. Ours was supposedly a "twin" but the beds were pushed together with no gap and there was still only just room to stand on the other side. The photos are seductive and misleading as the rooms are clean but basic - bathrooms are a little better with a good shower. Breakfast was adequate but simple buffet style fare. The hotel was fine but not good enough to return. I will definitely go back to the pantry though better than De Kas where we paid 150 euros for two!

Reviews.Title: “efficient service in a character hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cuddlicious
Reviews.Content: Check in is smooth and efficient in this boutique hotel that is formed from three 19 century houses. It's a good change from many of the post war tower block hotels such as the Marriott that is also close by. Its not the cheapest in town but the location is unbeatable. A comfortable 20 mins walk from most main attractions and close to Vondelpark if you fancy a fresh air jog. Its also close to the Bond St/Fiftth Avenue of AMS with some good shopping. Only downside in my double aspect room was that you could not open the windows. When I enquired about this- the duty manager personally inspected the room whilst I was out and wrote a note to advise me- which I very much appreciated. Shower pressure is great and the bathroom and room itself was clean and well equipped with good reading lights and a box TV. The hotel is about a 10 min cab ride from the main station and it is located in a quiet street close to the centre of twon. I would expect the hotel will want to undego some sort of renovation soon to give a little extra polish but overall it is clean comfortable and friendly hotel that has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisit”
Reviews.Author: schneira
Reviews.Content: absolut first Class Hotel! it's very comfortable. a small one, but very Luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: aadams3119Decatur_Tx
Reviews.Content: The Bilderberg Hotel Jan Luyken is on a nice quiet street in the Museum District, one block behind a street of luxury shops including Tiffany, Louis Vuitton, etc. The room was comfortable but there was no dresser, and very little storage space. The bathroom had double sinks and was roomy, and everything was very clean. The staff was accommodating, and helpful with questions we had about the city. Everyone spoke English which made it much easier for us. In addition the hotel sold public transportation cards, and admissions to the museums which was very convenient. The really big negative for us was that the internet service offered by the hotel was very expensive, and they placed a hold on our credit card of $66 USD everyday when we used the internet, even though we were only on for 30 minutes or less at a time. That hold was released at the end of our stay, and the staff said the hotel is looking for a better internet option. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL - PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: JENKS18
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel - clean, very comfortable, good reading lights and powerful showers. We booked a superior double and a standard twin. The superior double had a memory foam mattress and was larger than the standard room. The location was idea for the Van Gogh and Ritsmuseum. Trams were very close. The shops and restaurants and boat cruises were a few minutes walk away. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and elegant hotel on great location”
Reviews.Author: ivocro
Reviews.Content: Bilderberg Jan Luyken is located in the same street of Rijksmusum and few steps from Van Gogh museum too, Vondelpark and Leidseplein with many restaurants, bars and shops just around the corner.Dam sqyuare and Anna Franks house some 15-20 mins away by foot,Double standard medium size rooms and small but funcional bathroom are well equped (even magasines and guides about Amsterdam), very clean too. A star more for great team on the reception desk and chamber maid working on fifth floor. Extremely helpful and knowledgeable staff

Reviews.Title: “Clean enough, friendly enough, beware of some of the smaller rooms...”
Reviews.Author: ddh76
Reviews.Content: A good clean "work-type" hotel whilst well situated for all of the museums - Van Gogh, Rijkmuseum etc, it is quite a distance from the centre of Amsterdam - a good 20/25 mins walk to the Dam Square, for example. However, staff are very friendly and hotel is nice and clean - beware - it seems that the rooms on each floor vary in size quite drastically. Our bathroom was very cramped and the bath was very small - shower only really. Curtains didn't close in the middle which can always be quite frustrating! Room Service options are very limited too and the minibar is a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “If you are considering this hotel............go for it!!”
Reviews.Author: adventurer04
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a3 night stay at this superb hotel.We booked the hotel as a result of other reviews but then the reviews dried up and we wondered if we had made the correct decision especially as we required a twin room for the boys and the hotel won't guarantee a twin room at the time of booking. We need not have worried!! Everything was excellent - the staff were extremely helpful, in particular Jaimee who was on the evening shift who went out of her way to to help us and recommended some excellent restaurants. The rooms were on the small side but adequate for our needs as we were out all day and were extremely clean with effective air conditioning. Breakfast was superb with a good selection of fresh foods and the staff who worked in there were always incredibly friendly and efficient. The hotels location was excellent - situated in a quiet, leafy street yet within walking distance of all the sights. It is an expensive hotel - we felt it was overpriced but this was outweighed by the staff. Njhzxcvb nm, onetheless we can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smoggy1
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding anniversary in Amsterdam and stayed here. The staff were fantastic and gave us a free upgrade and complimentary champagne. They were really friendly and helpful thoughout. the room was beautiful with a balcony overlooking the pleasant and peaceful street at the front. Check in was smooth and there was no problem leaving bags prior to or after check in/out. A great experience made by the wonderful staff who work here. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful smallish hotel, great location. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: CAHBoulderCO
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Bilderberg Hotel after being disappointed in our first hotel. It was very , very nice -- incredibly friendly and competent staff, pretty interior, delicious but pricey breakfast. Our room was on the tight side because they squeezed in an extra twin bed for us, but it was manegable. We were gone from morning till early evening, but we always enjoyed coming "home." The street it's on is charming and quiet and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms - Trades on its location”
Reviews.Author: Paddy022
Reviews.Content: The awning outside this hotel has a star painted out. After having experienced its "charms" I felt like painting the rest out. Firstly it is expensive and trades on its location. However the facilities are very poor. In the bathroom we had, everything leaked. The bathroom was also smelly. The room itself was tiny. The decor despite appearances on the internet was shabby. Lights didnt work. The bed was made when we arrived but was not the cleanest - I suspect the sheets had not been changed. We came back to the hotel (to sleep) and needed another pillow - (there were no spares in the room) - this took an hour. The blackout curtains would not close! The staff with one exceptional exception were unfriendly if not a bit rude. A bottle of water from the mini bar was â‚¬5 - even by mini bar standards this was exceptional! By way of balance it has to be said that the hotel is very well located for the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum - but frankly the standards were totally unacceptable. While this hotel did not succeed in ruining a wonderful stay in a great city, it certainly took away from our enjoyment of it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalie1902
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated, very close to museums and close to the Leidesplein, where you can find a lots of restaurants and clubs. 5 min walk and you can take the canal cruise, so an excellent location for exploring this city. It is small and lovely boutique hotel, which overlooks a very posh shopping street. The rooms are a bit small, but very clean and have everything one needs for a short trip. The hotel service and the breakfast was very good and I have no complaints whatsover. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This IS a GEM”
Reviews.Author: jennyjones_8
Reviews.Content: W e loved this smart, modern small hotel, situated in the museum and fashion district close to the canal boats and tram stops. Unfortunately the standard boutique room we had booked on the net was the size of a British single. However, we asked to be upgraded to a superior room and this was modern, well appointed, large and attractive. The Recepiton staff were charming, efficient and could not have been more helpful with our problem and also with booking restaurants for us in the evening. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in Ams”
Reviews.Author: burrowbk
Reviews.Content: Love the location of this hotel, can't wait to go back for the third time next year. Hotel has one of the best locations in the city.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: NepeanCanteach
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in December and found this the perfect hotel for a short visit to the city. The location was great for visiting the museums and we were able to walk to every other central location for shopping and eating. The room was small but everything was there - a good bed and good reading lights - deep bathtub and a quiet location. The hotel staff was helpful and everything seemed to run efficiently. The breakfast was good but expensive. Overall a good hotel for a city visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guido_T
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Bilderberg Jan Luyken hotel for 1 night, very nice hotel at a 2 minute walk from the museumplein. The standard rooms are fairly small but offer everything you need and are well maintained. Hotel does not offer dining facilities, however there are plenty of restaurants within 5 minute walking distance. Good breakfast buffet and good service from hotel staff. Definitely a hotel I would recommend for some nights in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “disasterous and unprofessional attitude of staff”
Reviews.Author: ummfarah
Reviews.Content: We had paid in advance and had reservation for 2 nights stay at this hotel, on arrival were informed that our resversation did not exist on the hotels's computer system. The duty managress assured us that we will be booked into a hotel of similar star rating locally. In the event we were booked into hotel of lower star rating without much compensation and an attitude. I feel very let down by this hotel's management being dishonest and will not recomend this hotel for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tonks28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night when visiting Amsterdam for a weekend away. I had been to Amsterdam before and seen the 'main' tourist part like Dan Square and the red light district, but we wanted to stay away from that and see another part of Amsterdam. This hotel is in a great location and showed that there is more to Amsterdam than sleaze! It is about 5 minutes on the tram from the central station to the Rijksmuseum, and then about a 2 minute walk to the hotel - very easy to find. The area is called as the museum and fashion district of Amsterdam, and is near PC Hoofstraat where the designer shops are located and the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. Leidseplein, with several excellent bars and restuarants is about 5-10 minutes walk away. We arrived at the hotel early, and our rooms were not ready, but there was no problem with storing luggage. We found all of the staff on reception to be very helpful and friendly. We had booked standard double rooms. We stayed in room 110 which was on the first floor overlooking the front of the hotel. The room size was fine and we had plenty of room. I found it to be no different to most city centre hotels I have stayed in. The furnishings were modern and clean, the bed was unbelievably comfortable (my friend compared it to floating on a cloud!), and the shower was very powerful (although strangely placed on the side of the bath rather than at the end!). We didn't have breakfast as we thought E19 was a bit steep, but there are plenty of cafes round the corner. We thought this was an excellent hotel, and would consider returning to explore more of this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: ahonest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in September. We booked the Bilderberg Jan Luyken after much searching on the Internet - and what an excellent choice! The staff at the hotel were friendly and efficient and very welcoming. For an extra â‚¬25 per night we upgraded to a larger room, which was definitely worth it to have a little bit more space and comfort. The room was clean and had all the amenities we required. The hotel is a perfect location in my opinion. From Central Station take the no 2 or no 5 tram and get out at Hobbemastraat / Rijksmuseum stop. The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum are just around the corner and around the other corner is the Hoofdstraat - Amsterdam's premier shopping district. There are not many restaurants/bar in the area but Liedesplein is only a 10 minute walk and the trams run until about 0030. A nice bar for a cocktail or beer is Momo and is only about 10 minutes walk away from the hotel (head towards Liedesplein). A few tips... I would definitely recommend booking your tickets for the Anne Frank house online - saves the queuing. If you are into your cocktails and trying something a little bit different visit the House of Bols opposite the Van Gogh museum. Not only do you get a cocktail you also get to try some of the Bols liqueurs. The Canal Bus is an excellent way to see the city and you can hop on and off as you please. Pick up one of their timetables as well and you'll get discount coupons for restaurants/musuems etc. And finally, watch out for bicycles - they're everywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: mac7899
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last December. It's a beautiful building, in a wonderful location. It's close by the P.C. Hoofdstraat which is the premier shopping street in the city. It's also just around the corner from the the Van Gogh Museum which is well worth a visit. The staff are friendly, polite and efficient. The room we were given on the top floor was absolutely miniscule, and not as clean as I'd expect from this class of hotel. We had tried to stay here previously but there was a booking mishap and we were moved to their sister hotel, The Garden, which was slightly further out of the city, but we had a much bigger room and it was clean. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Throughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: EmmaScullyCardiff_UK
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Jan Luyken. The hotel was excellent. The rooms are small but this is to be expected in a cramped city like Amsterdam. Having said that, the size of the room (303) was not a problem, the room was very clean, modern and had a great boutiquey feel. The location is ideal in my opinion, its far enough out of the main centre (Dam Square) so its quiet at night but close to the excellent Rijksmuseum. Take trams 2 or 5 from Central Station to get to the hotel. The same trams can be picked up from the end of the street and will get you to Dam square in under ten minutes. The hotel can provide you with a Stippenkart which gives you 7 trips on the tram (or bus) for 8 euros. Also, the hotel will lend you a bike should you need one. We used bikes for the last two days and wish we'd done it right from the beginning. Believe me, i'm not a cyclist but i really enjoyed cycling in the nearby Vondel Park and going to the street market (mon - Fri 9-5pm) on Albert Cruyp Stratt. Also, get your museum tickets from the hotel. They get an allocation delievered each morning - so get to reception early. You will not have to queue. Last tip, make sure you book tickets to Anne Frank House online. The queue was around the block on Wednesday and we strolled straight to the front!!

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Hotel, but a Room to Avoid”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bilderberg Hotel Jan Luyken a few weeks ago. It was clean, the staff was polite, and it was within a very short walk (about 2 minutes) of both the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum (both of which were wonderful, by the way, and not to be missed). There were few restaurants nearby, however, which means you'll have to walk a bit more to get a taste of Amsterdam come dinner time. The main thing to be careful about regarding this hotel is that you should not let them stick you in Room 007. It is small, even by European standards, and right on the ground floor. The window overlooks the small outdoor seating area of the bar, as well. After traveling from the United States, we were jet-lagged and just wanted some sleep by the time 10pm local time came around. As you can imagine, the noise of conversation and laughter from the bar was somewhat aggravating. We would never have booked this room if we knew this room was not only on the ground floor but adjacent to the bar. This is not an issue of this being a cheaper room, either; it cost as much as other rooms in quieter parts of the building. Specify "no 007" when booking. I also felt that the hotel was a little too-expensive, as well, especially given the tiny room and the noise. I suppose the high cost of lodging is simply a function of Amsterdam, though. It is not a particularly inexpensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good part of town”
Reviews.Author: RedEyeDry
Reviews.Content: We got a great bed and breakfast deal at this hotel and it's definitely the best place we've stayed during our trips to Amsterdam. Staff were very friendly and chatty, always acknowledged you when you were coming and going and the reception was always manned. The room and bathroom were done out well and had a modern, trendy look. Plenty of wardrobe space and enough coathangers (one of my things!). Tea, coffee and a mini-bar were provided too. Our room was cleaned and towels were changed daily. Breakfast was fantastic with lots of choice, hot and cold. Staff at breakfast were very nice too and it felt like they took an interest. Breakfast finishes at 10.30am which is later than a lot of places, so great if you've had a heavy one the night before! Location is also great and near all the places we enjoy in Amsterdam, like Vondelpark. Trams and buses are right on the doorstep so it's very easy to get about if you need to travel a bit further. We would definitely make this our first hotel choice when we go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: FirstTimeHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We do think we had a superior room however, but as we never saw any of the others, we could be wrong. Regardless, this hotel is spotless, newly refurbished, very quiet and generally lovely. Breakfast was great, staff were lovely and very attentive. Perhaps a little bit out of the way but very near Vondelpark, Hard Rock Cafe, Rijksmuseum, and in a generally lovely, well to do area. Great suggestion if you are looking for a quiet trip to Amsterdam. About half hour walk to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: r0utard
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - a few blocks from the Van Gogh and Rijks museums. Could easily walk to Leidseplein and was a short tram ride to red light district. We got a room with a bathtub on the ground floor. The room was small (even by European standards) with a very small bathroom. Overall this was a satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harry_Callaghan
Reviews.Content: The Bilderberg Jan Luyken is a small hotel in a leafy neighbourhood close to the Rijksmuseum, the Vondelpark, the Van Gogh museum, and the Concert Hall. In practical terms it is 2 minutes walk from the No 5 tram (Hobbemastraat stop) and about ten minutes from the nearest supermarket (on Van Baerlestraat). It is easy to get to from Centraal Station using the No. 5 tram. There is a good selection of restaurants and cafÃ©s nearby on Van Baerlestraat and lots of upmarket shopping around the corner on PC Hoofstraat. Staying here you are far enough out of the touristy city centre, but near enough (via tram) to get their quickly. The hotel itself is friendly, homely and well kept. However, if you like spacious lifts and big rooms, this is not the place to stay. The rooms are smallish, but comfortably furnished (great comfy bed) and the bathroom well equipped. The lift is tight. But that's so much of Amsterdam architecture for you. Stayed three nights and would go back without a doubt if in Amsterdam again. The reception staff were chatty and spoke great English (we didn't meet anyone in Amsterdam who didn't). Breakfast was a bit expensive at â‚¬19 each for the buffet, but the food and the selection was good. Foregoing breakfast in the hotel you could certainly get a cheaper breakfast down the road if you wanted. The neighbourhood appears superficially quiet and the roads leafy and quite lush. But each night there was always some strange noise on the road outside to wake us up. The neighbourhood is not noisy, but it seems that the sound travels upwards and is amplified by the design of the street. One night it was an over-excited football fan, another night some enthusiastic revellers, but it was all jolly and wasn't like a marauding army outside. There are no real 'facilities' at the hotel, bar a small 'spa' with a sunbed, steam room and jacuzzi. It cost about â‚¬30 for 90 minutes and I never saw anyone use it. So no complaints and many fond memories of a pleasant stay. On a previous trip to Amsterdam I stayed in the 'old centre' of the city close to Centraal Station in a modern big hotel. The Bilderberg Jan Luyken was a much better choice and I am glad I found it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Time Travellers' Wife
Reviews.Content: My daughter booked this hotel for a surprise birthday present Never having been to Amsterdam before, did not know which area would be best for access to centre etc. Perfect choice, in quiet area but near to tram services, bus service, walking distance to centre and canal boat trips. Two minutes away from the designer shops and 10minutes to the 'city centre' Across the road literally to the museums and concert hall and Vondelpark. Perfect location. We were given an upgrade and were presented with a complimentary bottle of wine on arrival for my birthday! Superb start and very much appreciated. Room very clean, comfortable bed, all facilties. Internet, etc etc bar, tea making facilities, robes, slippers etc. as well as all the usuals. Breakfast though good, we did feel was a little overpriced at E19 so we went to the centre and ate well there instead. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly without being too familiar, and couldnt do enough for us. The hotel/airport shuttle was great, and wellorganised, and as we purchased our museum tickets from the hotel we avoided the queues. I will definitely return, and will recommend this hotel. My daughter and I really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanjuanisland
Reviews.Content: A wonderful, small hotel. I stayed there before, and it was great again. The staff was superb--even better than last time. The locations is excellent for a visit to Amsterdam. 2 blocks to the Rijksmuseum and about 4 the the Concertebrouw. It is close to walk to the core. The rooms are well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheSeeker15
