Reviews.Content: The Bilderberg was a great hotel. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The bed's are amazingly comfortable. It's located in an upscale area of Amsterdam, just steps away from the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, and one block from the tram stop. Leidseplein is only a five minute walk or one tram stop away. Many great eateries are located near by as well as great coffee shops. Amsterdam is quite small and can be traversed on foot but the proximity to the tram stop is a great bonus on those long days. The hotel in my opinion, is great for any traveler. If your looking to party and enjoy the coffee shops the location is good. A short walk or tram ride will take you to many great spots. At the end of the night you can return to your quite neighborhood and enjoy a goods night sleep. If the museums or your reason for traveling the Bilderberg is in a perfect location. Overall this is a great property.

Reviews.Title: “ok , been to worse for more money”
Reviews.Author: hughc
Reviews.Content: had four nights in noisy superior room on ground floor corner, damn mopeds at two oclock. though comfortable bed and big bathroom, no bidet, with internet connection. apple and turndown bed each night, radio tuned to skyradio. staff at reception very helpful re restaurants-- went to leidesplein area to eat. good breakfast included in price paid-- champagne eggs bacon cereals juice rolls croissants. int herald trib available to read at breakfast. Stored our baggage after we checked out as we were to be collected by car late afternoon. map provided as well as a couple of money-off vouchers for canal and other trips. very convenient for museums. recommend canal trip to orientate in city. trams convenient but jerky. watch out for cyclists who come at you from all directions and on the pavement.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tripamaniac
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy to know that we were staying in the upscale part of Amsterdam. The hotel is a beautiful boutique style hotel. We decided to upgrade our standard room to a deluxe room. We were glad we made the decision! The room was very comfortable. Hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful. You could not ask for a better location! Ladies, the Louis Vuitton store is directly behind the hotel! All the major museums are within a block of each other and the I Amsterdam sign is directly across from the hotel. The hotel is really not that far from the city center. You can actually walk to Central Station in about 30 - 40 minutes, however, make sure you know where you are going! You can easily make the wrong turn! The tram is within a block away, so if walking is intimidating, you can hop on the tram. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ellen_faith
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel, on a very quiet tree-lined street. We checked in on a Monday and before seeing the room asked if there were any upgrades available. We got a business class room with a little balcony. The room was indeed small by American standards, but our friends from Amsterdam who visited our room said our bathroom was larger than their home bathroom. The room was extremely cute. Very close to the tram, therefore close to everything we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clair&Dave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the Fashion and Musuem district and is 5 minutes walking from Leidseplein. Check in was quick and they wished my Husband a Happy Birthday and also put the champagne in the room as requested. The room isn't massive but the bed is really comfy. It is very modern with an excellent bathroom. You can oder breakfast but at 17euros each we decided to eat out every morning. The bar is nice but again expensive and we only stayed for 1 drink. We didn't use the spa but it looked very nice. Overall a fab location and really helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Clayre8077
Reviews.Content: My party stayed in this hotel for 3 nights 7-10 February & booked through hotel.connect.com - where we had 3 nights for the price of 2 saving Â£630! The hotel is in a beautiful location, close to the Reichs Musuem & adjacent to exclusive shopping area. A short stroll took us to the canal & tram stop & it was aproximately 20 minutes walk to the Anne Frank House. We stayed in a triple & a twin room. The triple room was extremley spacious with all mod cons. The shared room was much smaller, but our party had no complaints. The hotel is very clean & the staff were extremley courteous & helpful when asked for directions, restaurant reservations etc etc. Breakfast is buffet style - cereals, selection of breads, meat, scrambled & boiled eggs. Our only complaint was constantly having to ask for pots of water to make tea & coffee, as they only gave us 2 small ones for our party of 5. The Spa in the hotel is actually a small room on the ground floor with a bath, shower with jets & a recliner - give it a miss! We went to a chinese place for massage ($20) over in Dam Square. There are lots of lovely restaurants nearby, we ate in a great tapas place & had lovely bagel tapas in bagel & bean. A great time had by all & would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: LJASurrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a residential street, with a very nice shopping street behind the hotel in the next street. The room was a bit small but perfectly adequate for our needs as we spent very little time in the room. Very pleasant decor. We deliberately chose the hotel as it was away from the main busier areas of the city so were disappointed to have had two restless nights. We stayed in room 110, which was quite close to the main stairwell and lift and being only one level up from the street it was noisy all evening through until 5:30 in the morning from people on the street below. The noise was our only concern. I have read reviews that say the hotel is too far out. It depends on what you are looking for. The hotel is very close to the Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum. Trams 2 & 5 stop at the end of the road and one stop in (2 mins) and you are in the main shopping street. We managed to walk around in one day and see the majority of the sights so I would disagree that its too far out. All in all we had a really nice time in Amsterdam and got to see everything - even if we didnt manage to get much sleep!

Reviews.Title: “a lovely small hotel near the museums”
Reviews.Author: SteveKIngston
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Jan Luyken is around the corner from 2 major attractions in Amsterdam, a block from an exclusive shopping street and a block from tram station that takes you everywhere. Dam square is a 20 minute walk past the most beautiful sections of canals and bridges. It is a lovely small Dutch hotel on a quite street with very freindly helpful staff, very comfortable beds and a good breakfast. For North Americans the cigarette smoke in the dining room and bar is an initial shock but it is pervasive throughout Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect European getaway”
Reviews.Author: seeker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chic and elegant with a friendly and professional staff. Though the room was small, it was well-appointed and made good use of the limited space. The bed was very comfortable with a down duvet and very nice pillows. The only complaint I would have about the room was that the reading lights over the bed didn't work. Beware of the breakfast. It's expensive. We mistakenly assumed that the breakfast was included with our room and had we thought about it would have taken our morning coffees and meals somewhere else. It was a very good breakfast though. Also, the internet fee of 5 euro for 5 minutes was crazy, but I had not choice as I wanted to confirm the return flight home. The room offers free wireless though. I would recommend this hotel, just be mindful of any extra charges. Can't beat the location either.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money - this 'hotel' is a joke !!”
Reviews.Author: TraceWicklow
Reviews.Content: Despite reading previous reviews regarding problems with checking into this hotel I decided to stick with my booking at the Bilderberg and make my own mind up. I shouldn't have bothered. We also arrived into reception where we were told by the receptionist that our 3 night reservation was actually in their sister hotel which was located back towards the airport. I had my booking confirmation but it would appear that this is not worth the paper its written on !! We were told that all reservations go through a central reservations booking system that does not stop accepting bookings even though the hotel is full. I booked this hotel in July yet heard nothing about it being overbooked. To say we were very upset is putting it mild. We asked to speak to the manager who explained (to make things worse !) that they had a large group arriving later that day, and in order to accomodate them, we had to be moved to the other hotel ! An hour later into our first afternoon in Amsterdam and they can still not see really what our problem is !!! We were given 2 options by the manager : 1. They would try and check out availability at other hotels in the area or, 2. If we would agree to move to their sister hotel for Friday night and come back for the following 2 nights they would upgrade our room. I fully believe that had we not created such a fuss, we would have been sent to the other hotel for the 3 nights. We didn't see we had much of a choice so we waited for another taxi to bring us back the way we came, to check into another hotel for 1 night. At this stage the afternoon is lost. I asked the manager did he think this system of booking was acceptable and he agreed that it wasn't but they simply did not have a room for us until the large group left on Saturday. We both really got the impression that this is a fairly regular occurance at this hotel and we were absolutely disgusted at the way they conduct business. Also, if you book a non-smoking room don't think you will be in a smoke free floor. We were on the first floor where the rooms were non-smoking however both nights we arrived back to our room, we found fellow guests sitting on the stairway smoking outside our room. Would I recommend this hotel ? NEVER ! This place makes Faulty Towers look good !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travellinghappyfeet
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very pretty, located in a quiet street behind P.C Hoofdstraat which is a high-end shopping area. Also very well-located for the Leidseplein which is about 5 min walk away and the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum are virtually next door. Standard rooms are very small but comfortable but business rooms are bigger and well decorated. Reception was very friendly and helpful, breakfast was extra but generous, even with champagne! Internet access was charged at an exhorbitant rate and faxing was very slow and equally expensive. Overall, a charming hotel, good for a weekend getaway and very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaFlyer
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire and I expected a four star hotel. The room I got was no bigger than a jail cell with a bed couch/combo. Overalland for the amount paid thought that was ridiculus. Attached is a room photo.

Reviews.Title: “nice area noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: shareforfun
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because it is just around the corner from Van Gogh museum and had good reviews on Trip advisor. On arrival we found the area looked really nice, very near an exclusive shopping street and in a residential road. On check in we were told the hotel was full, despite having a confrimed reservation from them. Luckily we arrived early so we refused to move to their sister hotel (which is not so central) and were given a room in the Jan Luyken. Room was small but clean. Hotel was within walking distance to the Bloemenmarkt and near the pretty canal areas, also good connection with tram 2 & 5. Unfortunately we did not sleep at all as there were countless loud drunks roaming up and down the street until 3am, our room was on the top floor facing the street, it was a bit dissapointing as we had searched for a place that seemed to be quiet - this is the reason why the overall experience is average. Breakfast was extra 18 Euro per person, selection was good though price is a bit high. Parking was horrible - on the street and 34 Euro a day!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Experience - Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: silk_star
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel several months ahead for a special weekend for my boyfriend's birthday. I booked it direct thorough the hotel, after lots of careful research and swapped a number of emails ahead of arriving with the hotel to arrange champagne in the room, a nice view etc, all of which were handled politely and I thought successfully. On arrival the hotel clerk looked very worried when I gave my reservation details and asked to see a copy of the confirmation email. They then explained that the hotel was fully booked as they had a wedding party in, had managed to 'lose' our booking and had no room for us. They then offered us a room at a near by hotel. This hotel was of a much lower star rating (the main entrance to the hotel was via stairs at the back of a restaurant) and not at all what I was expecting in light of the booking I had made with this luxury hotel. On refusing to stay at this hotel and coming back to the Bilderberg to speak to the manager who was rather embarrassed at this, they found us a five star hotel elsewhere - but only because we kicked up such a fuss. But this was a business hotel - not quite the romantic break planned - and was a fair distance out of central Amsterdam. So all I can say is think very carefully about booking this hotel. Not only did they 'lose' our booking, despite several emails on the champagne and layout of the room, how they reacted subsequently in trying to put us into an inferior hotel was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: rosepig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jan Luyken during the summer and had a wonderful time. The location is ideal, right across the street from the Reiksmuseum and a very short walk to the Van Gogh museum. The staff was so helpful and you can buy tickets to the museums at the front desk. You can also pick up the tram right across the street from the hotel. In addition, there is a supermarket 3 blocks away which was convenient. If you are interested in high end shopping, i.e. chanel and louis vuitton, it's right around the corner. The rooms were clean and modern. I highly recommend this hotel. Staying there made my first trip to Amsterdam extemely enjoyable. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved our room”
Reviews.Author: jennifert33065
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon trip and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The hotel is very conveniently located across the street from the Rijksmuseum, and easy to get to from the Leidsplein or Museumplein tram stops. Our room was very modern and comfortable, and we found the staff to be friendly. It is a quiet hotel, which backs onto a street with many upscale shops. Leidsplein, which is a short walk or tram ride away, is a great area to visit at night, as it has a lot of restaurants and nightlife. We really enjoyed wandering around Amsterdam and we did a lot of walking. I also recommend buying a card of tram tickets; we were able to purchase these when we arrived at the Centraal train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: London-honeymooner
Reviews.Content: I booked a surprise weekend in Amsterdam for my husband's birthday. He is a fan of boutique hotels and this seemed like one of the nicer ones. Unfortunately, it is not quite as quirky as many boutique hotels, the style is quite bland. However, it's very smart and spotlessly clean. For some reason in the evenings the maid turns on the radio tuned to the Dutch equivalent of Capital Gold and leaves you an apple each (a ritual I had never seen before, but handy if you like Phil Collins and apples). It's also within spitting distance of the Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh museum. We stayed in one of the larger rooms (room number one) which was right on the street so got quite noisy on Friday night. I'd definitely recommend earplugs. It was quite roomy though, and the bathroom was lovely. The hotel has a small but attractive bar area and a sitting room. It also has a poky and dark breakfast room in the basement - it was a shame that we couldn't have had breakfast on the patio on a sunny morning. There is no real restaurant, but nearby streets are packed with great places to eat and drink. We stumbled across Witte Uyl (the White Owl) just around the corner on Franz Halsstraat 26, which is easily one of the best restaurants we have ever been to, in any country, ever. Amazing food (Gordon Ramsay has a few things to learn from this lot about combining flavours), pretty venue, charming staff, not too pricey. Go there. Back to the hotel though - the staff were very friendly and on hand with advice about what to do and where to go. I wouldn't want to stay in this hotel for more than a weekend though. It would get a little boring. And you'd get sick of apples.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: FazSydney
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,very clean and very friendly hotel in a very great location,walking distance from the main area of dinnig and shopping mal and the rest of the attractions. Reasonable price,quite area. Highly recommanded.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marais1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jan Luyken for one night in October, 2006. The hotel is conveniently located several blocks from the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. It is also a very close walk to the upscale shopping district. The lobby of the hotel is clean and bright, with friendly and helpful staff members. As is usually the case in Amsterdam, the staff spoke perfect English. The hotel maintains a cozy bar/lounge area and a small spa. I stayed in a regular room, which was small. However, the space was arranged well, so it did not feel cramped for one person. The furniture and fixtures in the room gave it a modern feel. The bathroom was among the cleanest that I have seen. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. Pictures to come shortly.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for travelers interested in style and convenience”
Reviews.Author: flash_tsquare
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a convenient location, practically next door to a main-line tram stoop and the two major museums, and only a block away from Amsterdamâ€™s upscale shopping district. The staff was friendly, professional, and very helpful. Our room, although small by American standards, was attractive and well appointed. The breakfast buffet was marvelous, but very expensive (something we didnâ€™t realize until checkout time). Located in the high-rent district, restaurant choices in the hotelâ€™s immediate area are limited. I would recommend this Hotel Jan Luyken to wealthy travelers interested in style & convenience. â€œRegular folksâ€� might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Euro Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zuttoman
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay here. The room was nicely appointed and very stylish. It's small...but it's Europe, all rooms are small by American standard. More importantly, I found that everything in the room was thought out and well designed. I found the location excellent. Any location you choose in AMS will put you closer to some things and farther from others. Personally, I'd rather be nearer the museums and parks and only go to the red light district if and when I choose. Also, I found canal boats and relaxing way to get around town and the dock is just in front of the Riksmuseum which is two minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: 22Sunday
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent. Bike rental, canal cruise, cafes etc. nearby, but not as crowded as other places. Rather quiet street. The city is small anyway, so donÂ´t be afraid if you see the location on a map. Room: Had room 210 â€“ not huge, but clean and nicely decorated, small balcony. Staff: Very friendly and helpful, way above average. Pricing: EUR 245 for a Sunday and 145 for a Monday. I guess Amsterdam is just popular and expensive â€“ try to book early wherever you want to stay. Breakfast: Did not have it at the hotel, went to a small cafÃ© on Max Euweplein (where the chess players are) that had excellent sandwiches. Forgot the name though, itÂ´s the one next to the Japanese place. Would try to find something cheaper next time, but apart from that I can recommend the Jan Luyken.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: busterlucy
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to stay at this hotel after reading rave reviews. However, it was a very disappointing hotel. Upon arrival the clerk tried quite hard to get us to upgrade to a bigger room. Then we found out why. The room they gave us was literally no bigger than the bed. There was no place to put anything except the bed and a tiny little narrow closet where one could only hang things, but the door had no room to open. The bathroom was not only the type you'd find on a ship (drain in floor, no shower or tub, just a corner!) but it was also dirty. Lastly, there was one tiny light making the room very dark. We couldn't believe it because we'd paid about $250 per night! When we asked to be moved to another room they didn't put up much of a fuss, but said we'd have to move back again the next night which meant that we couldn't unpack, etc. I imagine it happens a lot. We actually heard lots of other people complaining. The second room was much bigger and had an actual bathroom. And it is essential to ask for a large room when booking to avoid this mess. Also, the hotel didn't change money, sell stamps, or give helpful advice about getting around town. The location was excellent for 2 major museums, however, was a bit of a distance from the rest of town and was in a very, very expensive area. We wouldn't stay there again. There are wonderful looking hotels for half the price everywhere you look in Amsterdam and we felt like we'd really made a mistake. We didn't let it ruin our trip but felt we could have done a lot, lot better for what we paid. Amsterdam is a popular place and it's wise to book EARLY!

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend this excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulesHendy
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of reviews before we stayed here, we can happily say that this lovely hotel exceeded our expectations. The location is excellent - in a quiet side street but within walking distance of museums, shops and bars. We had such fabulous weather we walked everywhere and never used public transport which was a great way to explore the city. The room was a little small (with more furniture than was really necessary) but we had expected this so when we were offered an upgrade for â‚¬20 per night we didn't bother. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had both an overhead "waterfall" shower as well as a hand-held power shower. Even though there was some renovation work in the same street we heard very little noise from our room. The staff are friendly, polite and helpful. During our stay Kellie on reception and Robert in the bar were particularly kind and informative - even leaving a surprise gift when we told them we were celebrating my birthday. The buffet breakfasts are brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Billderberg was brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: nugi
Reviews.Content: Sometimes when you read these kind of reviews, you aren't really sure if they're completely accurate, but I can confirm the last 2 reviewers were absolutely right in their descriptions. My husband and I were looking for an elegant and peaceful hotel in Amsterdam, close to key attractions (but not in the "touristy" centre) and found the Bilderberg met all our expectations. We could have booked online, but decided to call the hotel direct. V. good experience, I spoke to two helpful people (Danielle and Kellie), explained we were on our anniversary and wanted their nicest superior room. All sorted and I received email confirmation within a few days. We had one hiccup when we arrived - having met the friendly Kellie on reception, and getting our keys to Room 306, we found the bed in this room was essentially twins pushed together. As a married couple on our anniversary, this was not really our preference. But with one phone call to Kellie, all was sorted and we swapped keys for Room 311 right opposite with a king bed. I think we were lucky, though, as 2 nights later the hotel was full. The room was very spacious, and above all quiet. Good facilities such as tea/coffee, safe, minibar that you could open (e.g. we could have used it to keep some milk cool), all in a neat unit. Bathroom also good size, with a shower unit over bath, useful accessories like cotton wool pads, and I was glad to see a matching pair of bathrobes and slippers. The wardrobe has been described as small in other reviews; I'd say rather they are compact but there is sufficient space for everything - 5 days worth of clothes (with day and evening outfits) for 2 people fitted easily. Having been for a 2mile walk in the storm on the day we arrived, we were quite tired ... and then had the best night's sleep ever - the bed was so comfortable, and not a sound, either from outside or from within the hotel itself. In fact, during our entire stay we only ever heard one noise, but that was around 10am. Breakfast was a typical Dutch spread, with a selection of juices, cereals, cold cheese and ham, fruit, at least 6 types of bread plus pastries/croissants, and 3 hot dishes. A very generous spread indeed, and we only ever needed a small snack for lunch, as it really fuelled us up for all the walking we did. The tram stop (2 or 5) is just 1.5 minutes around the corner, and takes 10 mins into the main centre, 20 mins to Centraal Station. Just in front of the tram stop is the entrance to the Rijksmuseum, and it's only a 5-7 min walk to the Van Gogh Museum. For all those who can't resist shopping and designers...you'll be glad to know that the hotel is just around the corner from the Amsterdam equivalent (P.C. Hoofstraat) of London's Kings Road - designers galore for shoes, bags, clothing even chic little cafe-restaurants. A little rich for us, but we had fun window-shopping before collapsing over a cafe au lait at the corner. It's hard to list a downside, but if anything I'd say it would be great if they had a fuller room service option. The night we arrived it was teeming down with rain, and though the hotel kindly lent us some golf umbrellas, I'd have preferred to have eaten in, but the room service menu is quite slight and expensive for what is on it. That said, the food we did try was delicious! There is a great looking Indonesian restaurant around the corner that is worth a try, not sure about the Italian/Argentinian one. Also - give the "spa" a miss. We didn't try it, but it is very inconveniently positioned next to a Ladies and the open lounge, and consists of a sunbed, a chair with built-in massage facility and a whirlpool style bath. There are better salons close by. Finally, all the staff we met were lovely and couldn't do enough to help, from sorting out post to lending golf umbrellas, etc. A few tips: on arrival at Schipol, buy a Conexxion ticket (E12.50 one way, per person, E19 return) before you leave the airport, and take this shuttle bus to the hotel. Much cheaper than a taxi (E35-40) and safer/less hassle than getting the train to Centraal Station and then a tram (pickpockets). Ask the reception to book your return journey, giving a minimum of 2 hours notice from when you need to leave. Save time on queuing and buy your tickets to the Rijksmuseum / Van Gogh Museum at the hotel - they probably also sell strippenkarten for the trams as well though we didn't need them. Go to the public library on Prinsengracht where you can use the internet for free for 30 mins per person and print out boarding cards etc; you can do this at the hotel, but at an extortionate rate. A brilliant choice, we enjoyed every minute of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: mince963
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel online and booked it after checking the reviews on trip advisor. We booked online and got a cheap rate but took advice of the reviews and upgraded to a superior room. The hotel replied promptly to our E-mail in perfect English and everything was sorted out with no hassel. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. We arrived early at 10 am and the room was ready to check in to despite the advised time of 3 pm. We didn't eat in the hotel or use the spa but we did use the bar a couple of times. The staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. The location is good, just far enough to avoid the noise of the city center but within easy walking distance of the bars, shops and restaurants. Close to the tram stops. Get the 5 from the station. The taxis are overpriced and take you on a city tour whether you want one or not. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hamsterjam”
Reviews.Author: Blue133
Reviews.Content: A lovely, welcoming hotel, we thought the staff were really friendly and helpful. It's near the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum but about a 25 min walk into the centre of town. Don't let this put you off, once you get your head round the tram system it's really easy to get around. The hotel spa is great, well worth giving it a go!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: M&LDerbys
Reviews.Content: Good location - close enough to walk into the centre but quiet enough to get some sleep (after all you are in a city) ! Hotel staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble - even returning jacket from sister hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Only the One problem!!”
Reviews.Author: Howie69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed for five nights from 20th - 25th November 2006. It was our friends birthday on the 21st and decided on this hotel for it's location and other 'good' reports on this site. Only a five minute walk to the Hard Rock Cafe and plenty of bars and eating places. Although we had requested superior, adjoining rooms, we found at check-in that they were on different floors! However the two guys on reception soon sorted this small problem out and we had room 101 and 102. Despite hinting of a special occasion our friend didn't have any wine in the room as mentioned in some reports!! ...........However, at breakfast the first morning, (on his birthday), the young waitress who's name escapes me opened the Cava and we all had bucks fizz, it went down so well they brought out another bottle so were sloshed by 10.30am!! Superior rooms are a must, they were clean but the lighting was hopeless and a little too dark. We all found the breakfast to be first class with a large variety on offer. All of the staff were ok except for one....I guess all hotels have their 'bad-apple' and MEDDY was this hotel's bad one. We decided as it was raining to have food in the bar, we were the only guests in the bar area and it was around 9.30pm. There was no eye contact, he was rude....almost throwing the drinks at us, one of the orders was a pizza and when it came it turned out to only be cheese & tomato instead of what was ordered. When quizzed as to why he didn't inform us of a change he quite clearly couldn't care less!! No apology or anything. This spoiled what had been, a really good day! The rest of the staff were fantastic as was the whole five days. We mentioned the problem at check-out and the receptionist reduced our bar bill for that night by half and couldn't apologise enough. All in all well worth the money and we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy at the Jan Luyken”
Reviews.Author: Berkeleytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights, in room # 510, and were very comfortable, indeed. The feature I noticed first was the gorgeous tile panels just inside the front door. Further in, we could see the bar/cafe with a beautiful white fireplace, that looked very tempting. Each day, new flowers graced the bar, lobby and sitting room, too. We had a bit of a problem checking in because we missed our first night due to a missed connection in Chicago. However, the lovely young lady at the front desk (who took over from her colleague) told us that the reason our reservation wasn't showing, was because we had already been checked in, so that no one could have our room. Needless to say, I was much relieved. The elevator to the 5th floor was wide and roomy ( This is almost a novelty for European hotel elevators.!) I was a bit disappointed with the area off of which the rooms were placed, as it looked a bit institutional. Inside our room, however, I was very pleased. We had a very large bathroom, with huge black marble counter. All was spotless. The shower was great, and I enjoyed the hand held shower. Good toiletries were also supplied and replenished each day. One reason I did not give the hotel a 5 star rating was because there wasn't much room to put our clothes, etc. I had to move the extra blanket and pillow from the few shelves provided. However, the pillow and soft ,comfortable blanket were much appreciated. The room was set up for a business traveler, and even included a stapler and paper tray, which I converted to my own use for storage other than paper. The other reason I didn't give the hotel a 5 was because of the low lighting in the room, which made it difficult to read. The linens and towels were lovely, and the twin beds comfortable. The best feature of the room, for me, was the window with a view over the rooftops of Amsterdam, including a great view of the Rijksmuseum to the left. There was also a minibar in the room, which had enough space in it for the milk, etc. I bought at the local grocery store. A word of warning is that the bottles of water placed on the desk are not free. I did not see anything warning of the 5 Euro charge per bottle. However, I may have been negligent, as I am programmed to think that only items in or on top of the minibar cost money, and that water placed in other locations are free. To their credit, the front desk only charged me for 1 bottle rather than 2, when I explained that I was unaware of the charge. I also liked the electric kettle, and jar of tea, coffee, creamer and sugar. We were supplied with 2 glass mugs and teaspoons, so tea making was easy. Throughout our stay, I only heard the sound of the next door room opening twice. That's it. No noise from the other rooms. We were subjected to the sounds of revelers on the streets, which appeared very quiet during the day, but that only happened on Sunday and Monday night. For those bringing cars, it should be noted that parking in this area is quite expensive. I overheard the front desk clerk telling other guests that it costs over 3 Euros per hour to park on the street. The hotel will sell a voucher for parking, but it costs about 30 Euros per day. Parking on Sunday is free, however. We took the Connexxion Bus from the airport, which worked very well for us. The location of the hotel was brilliant. The main entrance to the Rijksmuseum was about 2 blocks away. A shopping street, which I likened to Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills, is one street over. It made for great window shopping. One of the best Italian delicatessans I've ever been to-Pasta di Mamma- is on that street (who's name presently escapes me) The deli has wonderful sandwiches, which are priced just about 4.5 Euros, and can be eaten on the premises or taken away. They also have gorgeous salads, pastas, meats, etc. It was an easy walk into central Amsterdam. If you keep walking straight after crossing the street and canal in front of the Rijksmuseum, you come to a wonderful street full of lovely antiques dealers. The Vondelpark was about 7 minutes away. The residential area near the hotel and Vondelpark is very beautiful, and reminded me of buildings in London's Knightsbridge. I would definitely stay here again, as the room, location, hotel facilities and staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aevin
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Bilderberg Jan Luyken for 2 nights 6-8 October 06. It's a fantastic boutique style hotel with exceptionally helpful staff. Location wise it couldn't be better. Right around the corner from both the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. The Vondelpark is also just a couple of minutes walk away and other attractions are easily reached either on foot or by tram. Tip: Buy your tickets for the museums at the hotel reception. Great way to avoid the queues!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: RedJ
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel for a three night stay in Amsterdam as a mini break after getting a really good deal on the price of the room on a hotel website. There were three hotels that we were looking at, and after reading the reviews for them on Trip Advisor, we settled on this one. On our arrival the staff were warm and friendly, taking time to show where the location of the hotel was in relation to the rest of the city and where the nearest tram stops were etc. so we wouldn't get lost. They also asked how much we paid for the taxi to make sure we hadn't been ripped off - offering advice on how much fares should be to certain places. We realised a certain amount of this was stalling as when we got to our room we found a freshly chilled bottle of champagne on ice waiting for us - I had mentioned the fact that we were recently married and there was a card congratulating us with the bubbly, so that was a nice surprise! Considering we had got a 'deal' on the room it was a good size with a lovely comfortable large bed, and very quiet considering the room was off the hallway near the lift. Both the room and the bathroom were impeccably clean and well maintained throughout the stay, with simple chic design, as was the rest of the hotel: it's a lovely traditional Dutch building that used to be townhouses, so there are quite a few old architectural features, but has been well designed with modern fittings that make the whole place feel very comfortable and well-heeled, but not austere as some chic hotels can. We felt very relaxed throughout our stay, and the staff were always friendly and efficient, providing us with bathrobes and an adaptor upon request (we weren't charged for the adaptor, contrary to someone else's review), and even booking us a table at a fantastic Chinese restaurant that they recommended to us (for some reason we both had a hankering for Chinese that night - go figure). I would definitely go back to this hotel, aside from having a lovely stay there and being made to feel pampered and relaxed, it's in a great location, on a quiet leafy street in a smart district, but also about a minute's walk away from the Rijkmuseum, and within easy walking distance of most parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkEMark
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jan Luyken in February this year. Excellent Boutique style hotel which is very well located, especially for the museum area. Booked directly with the hotel for a 3 night stay at a very good price which also included a complementary meal one night at the Jan Luyken's sister hotel in AMS. Had heard that some rooms were quite small so requested an executive room which was brilliant. Large queen size bed, satelitte TV, On wall CD player, Mini-Bar, Hairdryer, Nicely equiped bathroom with toiletries and nice decor. Hotel has a very chic feel to it and all the staff were very friendly. It's located more in the museam area but the neighbouring street has the main designer shopping area with name's such as Gucci, Armani, Fendi, Burberry etc.. all present. It's a 2 minute walk to the Rijksmuseum where the tram stop is also located. You can take 2 different tram lines from there. If i remember correctly the number 1 & 2 which end up at central station and pass all the main areas on-route. Total journey time is never more than 5 minutes. Would definately recommend this hotel to all travellers and its a refreshing change from the large hotels. Mark & Claire

Reviews.Title: “marvellous”
Reviews.Author: jetbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a mini break and loved it. Lovely modern rooms with a view, great staff and perfect location. Would definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: pupumann0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year in a wonderful room on a side street 1 minute's walk from the museums and no more than a 5 minute walk from the sights and sounds of Leidesplein. Great bed - massive! Wonderful bathroom - robes supplied! Chocs in late afternoon are placed on your pillow - we didnt do breakfast - no need since A' Dam is full of watering holes. The upmarket shopping district is one street away - and there ar great antique/book shops just across the canal from the museums. Walkable for most of the town but for the lazy days and the trainstation/airport the tram is at the end of the street. Quiet district and just a hint of luxury! Hotel has a little sauna room but its 'extra' Staff very helpful and very discreet. Hotel is in old comfy building - rooms are large. Definately worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get the right rate”
Reviews.Author: Steffihen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 3 nights in early March. It was a very good base from which to explore the museums and canal trips were available within a few minutes walk of the hotel. Most sights can be reached on foot within half an hour. The room was clean and comfortable but small. We paid half of the normal rate and I think we would've been disappointed if we'd paid more. The staff on reception were very helpful. All in all we had a pleasant stay but the hotel was nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Rutzie
Reviews.Content: We have never had such a small room, only a couple of metres larger than the bed. The bath was about 1.2m long ! The bathroom was so small that only 1 of us could stand in it. The location is great, close to main museums. Surprised that the Spa was at a charge of 35 euro and they even charged us for the water left in the room which is usually complimentory. Staff were courteous but I wouldn't go back there again. Tip: worth buying tickets for museums and attractions from the Information Centre as queues are then avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Jan Luyken is really close to everything and if you hire bikes you can get around so quickly. We loved it! When we arrived we were offered an upgrade for 25 Euros per night. We were already paying quite allot for our room, but when we saw the upgrade we took it instantly. The room was huge, the bathroom was huge and we had a balcony- it was perfect! However if we had stayed in the other room I would have been disappointed, as it was really small, there wasn't a bath and it was at the very back of the hotel. So we were lucky to have the upgrade. The staff were really friendly and informative- but they did include a sneaky charge for there services on our bill... Getting directions from the concierge should be standard and NOT charged for! Also I borrowed an adapter which cost me Â£9 per day (which they didn't mention when I asked for it). Other then the sneaky charges the hotel was great. I feel sorry for people who end up in the mini rooms. My advise would be to ask for an upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: QOTU
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jan Luyken for five days during our visit to Amsterdam and excursions out of the city. We upgraded our room to a superior upon arrival for an extra 20 euros a night. The room was lovely, with a balcony on the front of the hotel. In hindsight, I think we would have asked for one that was a little quieter at night. With the far end of the street being blocked off for construction, people driving down the street would realize this and then come backing all the way up again, so it could be pretty noisy. On Saturday night (at 2 a.m.!) there were even construction trucks going up and down the street. But the area was really nice. As others have said, a two minute walk to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh. It was a respite from the lively energy of the city center, Dam Square, etc. If you're a walker, the Central train station was about a 40 minute walk from the hotel. But there were trams you could pick up just a couple of minutes away that went there. The hotel was very nice to come back to at the end of a busy day. The bathrobes were a nice touch. There was a water heater for instant tea and coffee; not great, but enough to get you going in the morning. I thought $44 for breakfast for two was a bit steep, so we opted not to include breakfast in our reservation. There are quite a few little coffee shops where you can get great coffee and bagels or rolls, whatever you're looking for, within a five minute walk of the hotel. The staff were pleasant and courteous and unobtrusive. Except for a computer glitch on our bill where we had other guests room charges, and a 6 euro "reservation charge" that they tried to include on our bill "weren't you told about the booking fee?" (We booked through hotels.nl where it advertises no booking fee) I thought the hotel was in a wonderful location and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for nearly 4 years now, on and off. Its location and price have caused me to fogive its little quirks - like the run down elevator, the TV's that don't work very well (1980's models), inaccessible phones and boring breakfasts. However, the service I received there last time was rude and obnoxious and, quite frankly, since I am a regular there - I expected better. So now I've decided enough is enough, I'd rather stay at a hotel where the front desk staff don't treat you like a nuisance and where things in the room work. If you're staying on vacation for a few days - it's not bad. But if you're there on business, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: bristolreviewer
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Jan Luyken, and found it very good. There is an excellent bar. Rooms are compact but very tasteful and well equipped. Didn't take breakfast at the hotel - but plenty of choice of pancakes, bagels or even full Irish nearby! The hotel is on a quiet street but easy to walk anywhere in Amsterdam, and very convenient for museums and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Close from Musuems and 10 mns from City Center”
Reviews.Author: francky88
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Amsterdam. We spend 2 nights on 22 and 23 of februar on this hotel. Staff is nice, let's say neutral. Hotel parts like lobby, beakfast room look good. Elevator looks old. Rooms are ok, a little bit small. Bathroom is clean and size is ok. Rooms are not that cold when you find out how to turn on the heat (do not only use the AC). There is smthing else behind the curtains. Breakfast is 17 â‚¬ per personn with a good variety of food. The hotel is a 5 mns walk from National museum and Van Gogh Museum. It's 10 mns from Leidesplein with is the most animated place. Anyway you can take the tram 5 or 2 wich is 3 mns walk from the hotel and brings you very fast anywhere in the city center. Tram 5 or 2 take you to the Central Station in 15 mns (easy when you come by the train as we did). Hope this review can help.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: conthemon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights during January 2006. Lovely little personable hotel which is located right beside a tram spot so getting around was very easy. Also the Van Gogh museum and the national museum are literally about a 2 minute walk. The only complaint was that the heating in the room wasn't great - the heating system could not be changed and it was around -4 outside so the rooms got a little bit cold. Saying that if we'd bothered to ask the staff to help i'm sure it could have been arranged.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of our 10 year anniversary tour of Europe and LOVED IT!!! This hotel is in a fantastic location - close to many nice restaurants on the Leidseplan; close to Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum; close to Vondelpark; and as with just about any location in Amsterdam, within walking distance to any and every tourist attraction, without actually hearing the goings on all night. My husband and I enjoyed walking around at night after dinner as there is a music conservatory around the corner and you can hear the musicians practicing. The staff found out it was our anniversary and put a bottle of wine and some flowers in our room. It was fantastic! If and when we return to Amsterdam, we will be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Gezellig”
Reviews.Author: oohmercyme
Reviews.Content: Nice cosy hotel. Room was small, but nice. Good location and very friendly staff. Really enjoyed my stay there.
